content.rendered: No. “Noob gains” are matter of strength gains as compared to bodyweight. They have nothing to do with how long you’ve been training. If you’ve been eating and training badly, you can still take advantage of them if you get your diet and training routine in check. “Wasting” them is not a thing that can happen. If you have the abilities of a noob, you will improve like a noob.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Muscle Building 101
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Introduction There is an illusion of complexity to gaining weight and building muscle (perpetuated largely by people who want your money) but it is actually very straightforward. Your body requires a certain amount of energy (measured in calories) each day in order to fuel its activities. This is called your…

jetpack-related-posts.title: What does the science say about...
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Exercise science is an extremely complicated field, even for those who are immersed in it. It's important to maintain proper perspective when trying to dig into what's been found through scientific study. Many people try to do this and end up using a deeply flawed approach that only leads to…

jetpack-related-posts.title: How do I choose the right routine for my goals?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The choice of a workout routine is one of the most heavily debated topics, bar none, especially among those who are just getting started. It can often feel overwhelming or like you have no idea what's right for your goals and situation, what's the most effective or efficient, or who…

jetpack-related-posts.title: I'm not making any progress - What can I do?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Unfortunately, there is no definitive answer to what is keeping you from making progress. Instead, you need to approach this from a trial and error and process of elimination perspective - there are a number of things that you can try to see if they have a positive effect. We're…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Does cardio impair muscle gains?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: You may be here because you've heard the phrase "cardio kills gains" - Not to worry, this is a meme, and not reality. This meta-analysis of 10 studies found that doing cardio before resistance training had no apparent negative effect on hypertrophy, though it did negatively impact leg strength. This…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Adding Physical Activity
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Training, or Exercising? When adding physical activity to your life, it's important to first get clear on whether you want to exercise or train. Mark Rippetoe explains the difference very well: Exercise is physical activity performed for the effect it produces today — right now.
